Reviews.Title: “clean and tidy,excellent locate for museums”
Reviews.Author: moley72
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable. Great shower. Good location for museums. Buffet breakfast is excellent value

Reviews.Title: “Good value and close to museum!”
Reviews.Author: olasBH
Reviews.Content: The rooms are incredibly big, the staff was very helpful, and the breakfast was excellent and cheap!! Its near by van gogh and rijksmuseum and very easy to acess airport and station. I really recommend!

Reviews.Title: “High quality and clean but value varies”
Reviews.Author: Duncan555
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable and the 4 person rooms are more like a hotel than a hostel. They do however ramp the price extremely during holidays (over doubling) so it varies from good value to expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, except for cleanliness issues.”
Reviews.Author: Musicallyshruthi
Reviews.Content: For 23 euros a night an 8 bedded dorm that is a stone's throw away from the museums is great value! However, there was an issue with a disgusting blocked sink, which they didn't sort out till late in the morning, even though we complained the previous evening. The dorm was a bit crowded, it is essentially a double bedded room with 8 bunk beds instead. But very far away from the seedier areas of Amsterdam, and has trams running to the Central Station every 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't believe my luck!”
Reviews.Author: MissDesigner01
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Amsterdam for 2 days and the trip didn't start well when I had checked into another hostel (won't mention names!) The next day I went online and picked a new hostel for the second night, not knowing what to expect really. I was so so so glad to have picked this place. As previous reviews mention- it's like a hotel at a hostel price. Good location near the park, and very clean and professional. Every time I go back I will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hostel- practically a hotel”
Reviews.Author: stmandula
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in March 2012 and was very impressed with the location and cleanliness of the hostel, especially the shower/bathroom facilities. The hostel is within a stone's throw of the Van Gogh (duh) and Rijksmusem and is only a 15ish minute walk from the center of the city and whatever you want to do there. The hostel is in a pretty nice part of the city (the next street over is the "high end" shopping street) so it feels very safe, all of my female friends felt comfortable walking around at night there. My 6 person room was a tad cramped, but the beds were comfortable. A pillow and towel were included in the rate, a major plus! The breakfast cost 5 euro but was well worth the value. Will definitely stay here the next time I am in Amsterdam, I'm sure I'll be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Van Gogh Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charlie_r251
Reviews.Content: I stayed her in Feb 2012 and I was not disappointed with it being a hostel, it is in a good safe location of Amsterdam, so safe that there is a nursery/ school on its doorstep. The hotel was clean with friendly staff who were very helpful, particularly with providing us with an extra heater as the weather was in its minus 10 in Feb, Arriving on a early flight we headed to the hotel in the hope we could leave our luggage in a safe room, to our pleasant surprise we were able to check in to our room 3 hours before as room was ready and this at no extra cost. The hotel is close to Van Gogh Museum, I AMSTERDAM sign and much much more, great restaurants, bars and shopping close by, particular for those love their designer wear. We had a double room but hotel offers larger rooms for large groups, you get many foreign students stopping looking for a good weekend, no problems, everyone is there to enjoy themselves. Would I stay there again, most defiantly.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: sherbert_12
Reviews.Content: This was only my second experience with a hostel but it was amazing!! Room was kind of small for 4 sets of bunk beds but it was still comfortable. Beds and room were cleaned every day. Safes were provided in the room for each bed. Luggage room was available on the first floor but we felt comfortable with our room mates so we didn't even use it. The bathroom was so big and shower was new with great shower pressure. Staff at the front desk were very helpful. Really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Van Gogh Hotel Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: annie_nn
Reviews.Content: This hostel looks actually like a hotel.it is very clean and in our shared bedrooms we had safes to look our valuable things. everyday they make the beds and you get clean sheets and towels.we didn't have breakfast there but you can get one and pay separately for it. it's just next to the van gogh museum, so very in the center of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hostel”
Reviews.Author: Traveller07_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in January 2012, having been booked-in by my office and billed as "it will be a nice experience for you" . It is smack in the middle of the Museumplein, so very central and within (mostly walking) distance of all major 'sights' in the city. The hotel/hostel is situated on a very quiet 'pedestrian' side street; though, facing a primary school building so there are children playing in the street during play-times in the day....but that was nice. The street itself runs off one of the the very chi-chi 'Bond Street - type' roads famous in Amsterdam; so leave wallets behind if taking your partner shopping !! My single room, facing onto the back of the hotel, was quiet, beautifully-decorated (with a large Van Gogh mural on the wall behind the bed, of course), clean, and fully furnished; including brand-new (shower) bathroom & fittings, flat-screen TV, lift access to 4th floor etc There is WiFi throughout the hotel and the #5-Euro breakfasts are in a communal area next to the lobby with all the standard 'help-yourself' foods and facilities of any major hotel in the city. Only difference is that guests have to put away their trays and used items; which is a fun 'change' from the fussy performance of the normal 4*/5* hotels where I normally stay; and where the breakfasts can cost up to #80Euro's ! Being a hostel - even if a classy one - most residents are young (late teens/twenty's) so the atmosphere is 'buzzy' but civilised. The front-desk staff are efficient, rather than overly friendly, but this is fine, and they are very helpful about transport & tourist information e.g telling me how to get a #4Euro bus-ride to the airport ,vs #50Euros by taxi !! The latter price is what I paid for the room per night! All-in-all, this is a 'gem' of a place to stay in Amsterdam as long as you are prepared to be a good friendly human being; rather than a 'stuffy' tourist, or on a Valentine's date with your loved-one.

Reviews.Title: “Great hostel, very modern and clean with easy access to centre”
Reviews.Author: theomerta
Reviews.Content: This is a great hostel, very clean throughout with only a minutes walk to the nearest tram station that will take you straight into the centre. Its got a great atmosphere in the dining area/lobby however I found the night staff to be pretty useless. A group of 10 of us shared an 8 bed dorm at the hostel. Initially the staff were helpful and offered to put two extra beds in the room so that we could all stay together. However as we were a bit late getting there, when we arrived we were told by the staff on night duty that they had assumed we were no longer coming. Luckily after some arguing and having to fork out an additional 10% booking fee (that we did not know much about) we were able to check in. I had another issue with the night staff later on when I tried to get a drink from the vending machine. It kept eating up money so I reported it to the guy on duty but he didn't care. Aside from the crappy nightstaff we all really enjoyed our stay. The room and en suite were really clean with fresh bed linen and towels. I would really recommend this hostel but try to check in during the day and avoid the night staff.

Reviews.Title: “First hostel experience - Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ross I
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the first week of January 2012 - a group of 19 of us, so we booked three private dorms, and all the rooms were finished to a very high standard. The rooms were all very modern and a very good size. Each bed has it's own safe and the en-suite shower rooms are very clean and again very modern. The â‚¬5 breakfast option was good value for money, but quite basic. Be careful to arrive well before 11 for breakfast, as there seemed to be a queue towards the end, and they clear away the food very sharply once it hits 11am. Would recommend this hostel to anyone, and the tram links just outside it make it very convenient to reach Dam and the centre of Amsterdam. Also, just around the corner is the Bols Factory - if you have a couple of hours free, for around â‚¬10 (student rate) you get the tour and a cocktail and two shots at the end.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Emma M
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hostel Van Gogh in september 2011. Me and some friends booked cheap flights and at the last minute found this hostel, Â£80 each for 3 nights on hostelbookers.com. We weren't sure what to expect from the hotel pictures given with the hotel information as these pictures are normally deceiving. We thought the hostel was great, very modern in bedrooms and recption/dining area. We were in a 8 person room with bunks, however there are private rooms also, there were enough safes in the room for every person, free of charge... I would recommend this hostel for a cheap getaway and somewhere clean and modern to stay. However the hostel is not in the city centre, we bought a 3 day unlimited tram pass for $15, and the tram stop was right ouside the hostel :) definately try the red light district pub crawl! This is a 5 star hostel not a 5 star hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Aquaii
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The room was great, very spacious and really comfy beds! The bathroom was clean and well maintained and the room was regularly cleaned. The staff were all very friendly and willing to give advice. Breakfast is 5 euro for all you can eat, I loved it as it was continental, but some of the rest of the group would have preferred more choice. There is a supermarket and tram/bus stop to the left of the hotel which proved to be very useful. The only bad thing was that the lift broke while we were staying there. This was fine for me as I was staying on the ground floor, but the rest of the group were on the 4th floor and had a long walk to their room! I suspect he lift broke because groups were piling in - even though there was a sigh saying 3 people only! I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very surprised - great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GemM210
Reviews.Content: Booked this hostel with a group of six 20-21 year old girls in the beginning of December. We chose this hostel because of its relatively cheap price along with the fact that the pictures looked 'nice enough'. When we arrived we wereextremely pleasedwith our room (private room for six sharing, with ensuite). The room had obviously been refurbished quite recently and everything seemed to be of good quality.... We even loved the bathroom with its huge double shower! The staff on reception couldnt have helped us more and were always willing to offer us directions or advice on the best places to go, even booking our tickets for the Amsterdam pub crawl (great fun!!). Location of the hostel was fine for us,in a relatively quiet area (near a street of designer shops). The tram stop is only a minutes walk from the hostel, and its a short ten minute or so ride into the main stops in Amsterdam like Central Station or Dam Square. I'd definately reccomend this hostel/hotel for anyone visiting Amstedam who doesn't want to spend loads on acomodation - I would happily stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “smell of pot whole night, kids screaming whole day!”
Reviews.Author: glhs
Reviews.Content: Hotel policy is non-smoking in public and private areas, but i dont think they reinforce it at all, at night time i could smell cigarettes and weed the WHOLE night, people talking about 'secret trips', random people banging on your door at 4 am, I thought there was a fire or something. They do have 24-hr reception but they just let random people in and out 24/7. And there's a kindy/day care right opposite the hotel, kids screaming non stop during the day... only good thing is the bed is quite comfy, but what's the point of having one with all those disgusting smell and noise?

Reviews.Title: “Klein aber oho :-)”
Reviews.Author: oevni
Reviews.Content: The rooms were a little bit small but it was clean and the furniture was also very modern and tasteful. The receptionists were very friendly and helpful. It is near the centre and nearby a lot of museums.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay”
Reviews.Author: goccmm
Reviews.Content: *Staff is ok. not that friendly. *WIFI signal is stable in the room. *It is more like hotel managing system. So it is pretty pricy for backpackers. (ave â‚¬50.00 per night in Superior 6 Bed Female Dorm Ensuite ) *Location is really good. Just right outside the Van Gogh Museum. *There are couple bus choices outside the hotel. Easy to commute to train station.

Reviews.Title: “Not disappointed at all.”
Reviews.Author: sOaOnOdOeOe
Reviews.Content: I've read some negative reviews of this place especially about the management but I found it to be okay. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. The decor of the rooms and bathrooms were modern. The location was great, right in front of the Van Gogh Museum and the trams stop right in front of the hostel. The only disappointment I had was that there were no places to mingle with the other travelers. Overall, I would definitely recommend others to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: unom3
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my bothers stag do. After reading the reviews I was expecting the worst. However was presently surprised to see that it had been recently renovated to a high standard and offered a travel lodge standard of quality for youth hostel prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Van Gogh Hostel”
Reviews.Author: FredricaIsrael
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Van Gogh Hostel (there is also a hotel section). We were in a 6-bed room with en-suite bathroom and toilet. I have nothing but praise for the pleasant staff and efficient pre-stay communication via e-mail. The hostel is newly renovated and the room was great - large, clean, everything lovely and new, great bathroom etc. Each person had a personal safe for locking up precious items. The breakfast was great at a cost of 5 Euros - wide selection of food including cold meats, eggs, bread, croissants and much more. Highly recommended for anyone looking for hostel style accommodation in Amsterdam - you can't do better

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Lauralou1000
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a night stay in hotel van gogh with friends. Great value for money and good location in the museum quarter. Trams every few mins to explore amsterdam or on foot. The staff were friendly, we even checked in 2 hours before check in time. The room was gorgeous, very spacious, twin room with flat screen tv, comfy beds and we even had a balcony with open out doors!!! very impressed! The bathroom was good with a huge shower. Hairdryer, toiletries and towels provided. everything was spotlessly clean. We would definitely stay here again and would reccommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I had checked some reviews before booking this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Andy H
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Van Gogh with a small group of friends for the Marathon weekend. The first room I was given was at the front of the hotel....very noisy when all the 'hostel' guests returned after their day/night out....added to that, the heating did not work so I had an awaful nights sleep shivering and having to listen to the inconsiderate idiots outside. Hostel? I hear you say.....yes HOSTEL! One side of the hotel offer double rooms which, I have to say, are actually comfortable although not very spacious and no tea and coffee making facilities, no drawers to place luggage clothing in and only three coat hangers (This is a double room by the way!). After complaining about the heating (and I am not the first) I was moved to the 3rd floor at the rear of the hotel. Much quieter but....the heating did not work! The other side of the 'hotel' is actually a mixture of single and multi-bedded dorms with a lift covered in grafitti that was disgussting. The managaement didn't seem to agree that this portrayed a poor image of their hotel when a friend and I bought it to their attention! No comfortable lounge area, a dining area that resembled a school canteen from the 1960's, although breakfast was good value for money, and absolutely no frills at all. Staff were, at best, a little helpful but mostly rude and dismissive in my opinion at at Â£160 a night, I felt well and truly ripped off! I have had better nights and superb service, in comparison, from Travel lodges and B&B's! My advice would be to look around for better before booking yourself into this 'hostel' that thinks it's a hotel! I will definitely NOT be staying there ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel. Decent value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Maverick145
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Van Gogh, Amsterdam with 2 other friends for 3 nights very recently. It is a small Hotel / Hostel. The hotel is very close to Van Gogh Museum. Its about 15 minutes by bus from Dam Square. We arrived pretty late in the night for our check in but we were greeted by a nice guy at the reception who patiently explained everything to us and answered all our queries. We had booked a 6 bed private en-suite room for the three of us. The room was decent considering the money we paid. The air conditioner was not working and the window in the room could also not be opened completely which made us feel suffocated. Overall, its a good value for money hotel with lot of youngsters staying in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice looking 'Hotel' but revolting service! Bed bugs! Dont stay here.”
Reviews.Author: LKD_13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not really a hotel, but not really a hostel either! When we booked our confirmation said 'hostel van gogh' but we arrived to find out it was really a hotel - so no hostel atmosphere whatsoever! Dont be fooled by the appearance of the hotel. It looks great but the staff at the front counter are incredibly rude and unhelpful. I do not recommend staying here, particularly if you are a backpacker looking to make friends. We found bed bugs in our dorm on our second night and it was handled incredibly poorly. After informing the staff, we were told to vacate the room and that we wouldnt be given any form of reiumbursement, despite not having a room to stay in for TWENTY HOURS! We were paying to stay in a private room at the hostel but had to move all our luggage into luggage storage until they sorted themselves out! My friend and i were incredibly distressed and after finding blood stains on our clothing we had to argue with hotel management to have our clothes cleaned at their expense. Finally after a day of being homeless we were moved to a dorm, and were told that we wouldnt recieved reiumbursement for the difference in price between a dorm and private room (was a considerable difference!) I would NOT STAY HERE. Also, please note that they didnt get a pest controller in to treat the bugs, they only changed the sheets - which makes me question the hygeine practices of staff at the hotel. DONT STAY HERE. It ruined our stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Maxweberko
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for one night. I had a bed in a mixed-gender room with other five people. I was surprised that the room was bigger than I thought and the toilet and shower place was quite tidy. The equipment looks like the ones in normal hotels but not for hostels. I like the lobby and the wide communication area. I used free WIFI there and checked information in the evening. The next day, I had breakfast which is 5 EUR for all you can eat. The variety of bread is okay. I have nothing to complain. In sum, I had nice experience staying there.

Reviews.Title: “The best hostel that is nearly a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrewsun
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hostel for three nights in August 2011. It is in a quiet part of the city in the heart of the museum, park and shopping areas (shops were too up market for us but it was nice to window shop though). Rooms were clean and of a high standard with TV, air con, toilet and shower, with free individual digital safes and wi-fi. Dont feel the need to travel all the way to Dam Square. If you walk through the Holland Casino area next to the Hard Rock Cafe you get to a lively area with good bars (The Last Waterhole) and places to eat ( De Blauwe Hollander) - Have fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: carrolldean
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights and didn't sleep once. The hotel is very noisy, most of the other guests stayed in their rooms drinking all night. The walls are very thin so you can hear everything that is going on two floors below. They leave the front door open all night but don't check that the people coming in are staying in the hotel, so anybody can walk in. I didn't like this because they don't provide lockers in the rooms. There's a shelf to put your clothes on but that's it. On my last night I went to the desk to see if I could get a private room to try and get some sleep. There was a group of Americans checking in ahead of me and I heard them being told that two of them would have to share a single bed for the night because the hotel was full. When they said they had a confirmed booking they were told it's hotel policy to overbook. All the staff on the front desk were very helpful and nice except for the Asian guy that works during the day. I asked him how much a tram into the city centre would cost and this seemed to annoy him greatly. Also, the lift doesn't work and like most Amsterdam hotels the stairs are steep. If you have a lot of luggage it might be a struggle to get it up them. The hotel's in a good location, but there are much nicer places near museumplein for around the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: wen_c82
Reviews.Content: I came across this hotel by accident as my first preference was booked and I want a clean room, this is just renovated. The hotel is in a perfect location for my purpose - visiting museums. You can take tram 2 or 5 and get off at Van Gogh Museum stop then walk a couple minutes. It is across from Hotel Fita. when I first arrived I thought it has a more hostel vibe. Indeed the hotel has a hostel on one side and hotel on the other side and they shared front desk and dining facility. When I was there it was quiet and I got a good night sleep. I reserved a twin room just because I know how small hotel room size can get in Amsterdam. My twin room was simply furnished with a 32 inch flat panel TV. The room was a slightly bigger than 2 beds so if you have a lot luggage this may be a problem. The bathroom was brand new also, clean with a big shower. - better than a 4 stars hotel I stayed. The check in process was a bit slow as the receptionist was new. I like the fact that WIFI is free and throughout the hotel. They also have 2 computers for you to use. Hotel charges 5 euro for breakfast which I think it's a good value in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: CoreyBaird
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at this hostel for one night and when I arrived the booking was made for the previous day. This was completely my fault and I would not normally write a review over this however how the staff handled the situation deserves mentioning. I waited in line for 15 minutes while the Asian male clerk handled an irate traveler in front of me. During this time he talked down to another staff member (Indian Female) which I thought was very rude. When it was my turn to check in he looked at the dates said I was late handed me back my paperwork and said in a snobby tone 'you late, you card already charged, goodbye.' In my brief moment that I was there and what they will not tell you on their website is there is a pre-school across from the front door with kids running and screaming during the day hours and the hostel is under construction. Just worth mentioning. I also found another hostel (Anne Marie) that was close by and the staff was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Under par -- and worse by the day”
Reviews.Author: topmooi
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Amsterdam many times over the past 40 yrs.-- in basic to comfortable accommodations, but never in luxury ones. This time things looked wrong: no proper power plugs/lights; no cupboard; no drinks on request; no working phone. Worst: All valuables were left out of the safe for 24 hrs., when I asked for them!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Van Gogh
HotelInfo.Address: Van de Veldestraat 5, Amsterdam 1071, The Netherlands (Formerly Vincent Van Gogh Hotel Amsterdam)
